questions.text: A mother with a newborn is worried for her child as the newborn hasn't passed the meconium till after 6 hours of birth. How much maximum time should she wait for the to pass out!

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the emergency unit after he is pushed down while playing. After falling on his knees, he developed swelling and bruising of his left knee. History revealed that his maternal uncle also has a similar presentation. What could be the probable mode of inheritance of this child's condition?

A couple is trying to have a child for past 2 years, after multiple unsuccessful trials they went for respective examination. Investigation of female came out to be absolutely normal but male shows presence of gynecomastia, small testis and scanty pubic hairs. He had a history of antisocial behaviour during school days. Most probably he has:
Which of the following conditions is associated with hypocalcemia, TOF, thymic hypoplasia and microdeletion in chromosome 22q11.2?
Mutation in NPHS 1 gene causes which disease?
questions.correct_answer: B. Congenital Finnish type nephrotic syndrome

questions.text: Henoch Schonlein purpura commonly involves which age group?

A 7-year- old female child presents with crampy abdominal pain and rash mainly on the back of her leg, buttocks as well as on the extensor surface of his forearm. Laboratory analysis reveals proteinuria and microscopic hematuria. Diagnosis is:
A 5-year-old boy presented with periorbital edema and pedal edema + ascites. Electron microscopy shows effacement of podocytes. Identify the condition.
A 5-month-old baby has respiratory rate of 58/minute and chest indrawing. The baby has not been able to feedfor last 10 hrs. What is the best management?

options.label: A
options.text: Prescribe oral antibiotics and follow up after 2 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Give first dose ampicillin and gentamicin and refer urgently to hospital

options.label: C
options.text: Reassure mother that it is just cough and cold

options.label: D
options.text: Do nothing, refer the baby to tertiary care center

questions.correct_answer: B. Give first dose ampicillin and gentamicin and refer urgently to hospital

questions.text: A one and half year-old child presents with single episode of wheeze and breathing difficulty. CXR is done and it shows bilateral hyperinflation. Which organism is most commonly responsible?

A 3-month-old baby is brought with complaints of fever and fast breathing. On examination respiratory rate=60/ min, child is irritable but mother is able to feed the child. There is no stridor, no chest indrawing, no convulsions. (Most Recent Question Dec 2019) Diagnosis is?
Which of the following clinical presentation is correct for a child with pneumonia?
A 2-year-old child who presented with fever had a RR of 36/min and chest indrawing, What is the diagnosis and treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Severe pneumonia: give antibiotics and refer urgently

options.label: C
options.text: Pneumonia, oral antibiotics and come back after 5 days

options.label: D
options.text: Give only antipyretic and send home

questions.correct_answer: C. Pneumonia, oral antibiotics and come back after 5 days

questions.text: A 5-year-old child presents to your PHC with complaints of diarrhea and is unable to take feeds or ORS. His weight is 17 kg. What is the amount of maintenance fluid required in 24 hours?
A 7-month-old boy was brought with a history of 18 episodes of loose stools and 2 episodes of vomiting. The child is irritable, but can drink eagerly. What is the best way to manage this child?

options.label: B
options.text: Give IV fluids for 4 hours followed by ORS

questions.text: A 7-year-old child is present with short stature. On biochemical examination, growth hormone levels are elevated with very low levels of IGF-1. Which of the following could be the possible defect in this child?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: 1 lakh IU every 6 months till 4 years of age

options.label: C
options.text: 2 lakh IU every 6 months till 5 years of age

options.label: D
options.text: 2 lakh IU every 6 months till 4 years of age

questions.correct_answer: C. 2 lakh IU every 6 months till 5 years of age
